summary: Captain Marvel was amazing. I cried like 8 times. Please go watch it if you can, you won’t regret it, i promise.

summary: FYI
body:
FYI

I will NOT post any gifs or content from Captain Marvel or Endgame until TWO WEEKS after release. At that point I feel it’s fair to start posting again.

Trailers and their content will be posted. All else will not be.

blog.name: starkravinghazelnuts
blog.title: "Give me a scotch. I'm starving."
blog.description: HIATUS/INACTIVE. a salty chompy mofo bitch. Marvel & sometimes other stuff | Spoilers | Hate-free (but there will be criticism) | Meta, gifs, art, everything goes. There will be multishipping. Header by @anthonyed

summary: Some spoilery speculation/theory for Endgame based on the scene showed to shareholders + Captain Marvel post-credits. Putting...
body:
Some spoilery speculation/theory for Endgame based on the scene showed to shareholders + Captain Marvel post-credits. Putting under a cut because of definite spoilers. 

So the post-credits for Captain Marvel confirms this scene:

… is the gang looking at Tony and Nebula landing (Carol is most likely the person digitally altered out between Bruce and Rhodey). Reason? The Omaze winner said that the Benatar lands in a “field,” and Cap’s outfit here is the same one he saw. (And the only other scene this could’ve been is Carol arriving, but the post-credits shows us how that happened–so that leaves only Tony and Nebula as the reason for this scene). 

A few days ago, a scene was shown to Disney shareholders from Avengers: Endgame, and it fills in some more blanks. For the link phobic, here’s the guy’s tweets compiled (with spelling corrections): 

The Avengers Endgame scene they showed was at Avengers HQ, Captain Marvel saying let’s go kill Thanos. Nebula says she knows where he is. Rocket says biggest energy surge ever seen on Earth when he used the glove, but it was seen again on another planet shortly after. So that’s where Thanos is retiring to. 

Quick exchange between Captain America, Natasha, Bruce, Rhodey, and Captain Marvel. Bruce asks what guarantee they have this ends differently. Captain Marvel says they have her this time. Rhodey asks where she was because they could have used her before. Captain Marvel says a lot of other planets out there need help and they don’t have Avengers like Earth has. Thor gets up from sitting quietly in back, walks up to Captain Marvel , and summons his axe, which whizzes right past Captain Marvel (she doesn’t flinch) into his hand and he says “I like this one." 

Cut to Milano [note: he means The Benatar], everybody buckled in, Captain Marvel in co-pilot seat. Rocket asks who hasn’t been to space. Captain America, Rhodey, Natasha raise hands, and Rocket warns them not to puke in his ship and off they go. Cool refection of stars and space stuff on Captain America’s eye as we zoom  in on him and they warp out of there.

Other details the guy shared: the clothes Thor is wearing in the first Endgame trailer? 

Thor is wearing the same outfit in the scene showed to shareholders. Worth noting that Cap was shaved in the scene the dude saw as well, which means it takes place well-after Carol arrives. 

So here’s the takeaways:

- The shareholder scene with Carol rallying the group takes place after Tony and Nebula get back to Earth (because Nebula is with the group and they use The Benatar to take off), but Tony is notably absent. (The man who saw the clip confirmed that Tony is not seen nor mentioned.)

- Scott and Clint are also absent–so this means that, more than likely, Scott’s inclusion in the Compound scenes was editing trickery. He hasn’t yet gotten out of the Quantum Realm by the time the group is rallied.

This also confirms that this scene? 

… is editing trickery. Scott doesn’t arrive at the Compound here–because otherwise he would be in the shareholder scene (but he’s not there nor is he mentioned whatsoever). ALSO–Steve and Nat are wearing the same clothes reacting to this message as they are in the field scene when Tony and Nebula arrive (!!!) which means that, more than likely, the message Nat and Steve are looking at is from Tony and Nebula (hence them going out into the field to greet them when they land). 

Timeline-wise, that means we currently got a sequence of events that looks like: 

1. Carol pops in and meets the Avengers (almost immediately post-snap).

2. Tony and Nebula land on Earth a bit later (Steve has shaved by this point). 

3. Carol, Steve, Nat, Bruce, Rhodey, Thor, Rocket, and Nebula use the Benatar to go off to fight Thanos. Tony sits this mission out (b/c he is back–just either too injured or despondent to help). 

4. Scott gets out of the QR.

This leads to several questions: Why doesn’t Tony go with the group? Is it because of his injuries? Is it because he’s quit? What’s going on?  

My guess is that when the Russos said Peter’s death would change Tony forever, they weren’t kidding. Tony, more than likely, has withdrawn from the Avengers, cloistering himself in his lab, abusing BARF tech and/or making a million modifications to his suit. Like I am thinking his state in Iron Man 3 on steroids.

When the Avengers propose going after Thanos so soon after they lost, I could see Tony taking a more pragmatic approach, expressing frustration, fear, and concern that they’re not ready–that six-years of preparation didn’t work, so rushing in won’t work either. But the group with Carol with them is now over-confident. Tony bails on the group–either believing they’re on a fool’s errand (or, worse, thinking he’ll just bring the group down b/c his own confidence is shattered).

So Tony sits out the big showdown with Thanos. The rest of the Avengers (+ their new allies) go into the skirmish over-confident.

… And get their asses handed to them backward (possibly losing someone in the skirmish, which would be a massive blow). 

It’s a classic storytelling arc. Attempting brute force only for it to blow up in their face. (And it’s a way to mitigate all the concerns about Carol being “too OP” if she gets humbled by Thanos’s power). 

This will lead to Tony, once again, thinking “I told you so,” because he warned them it was too soon, it was too dangerous. That there’s no current way to win. 

At this point, I think the other Avengers agree–and cue time passing (Natasha training, Steve going to therapy, etc.) 

It goes on like that until Scott emerges. 

I am thinking the security footage scene with Scott from the Endgame trailer… 

… is most likely Scott reaching out to Tony at his house. 

Scott was last on the west coast–and Tony lives on the west coast. It makes way more sense to seek out the closest resource than driving cross-country in a van to the Avengers HQ. 

Scott’s dialogue is more like he’s talking to someone he wasn’t personally allied with. Why say stuff like, “I got really big,” if it was someone who recruited him? He’s addressing someone who knows of him, but doesn’t know him. 

Plus the boarded up security gate? That looks like a private residence to me. Not a high-security compound. 

More than likely Tony has gone total recluse by this point–locked up his mansion, bulked security, doesn’t want anything to do with anyone in his desire not to lose anyone else close to him (remember he thinks Peter’s death is his fault). Worth also noting at the LEGO set of Tony and Dum-E shows that Dum-E is now equipped with a flamethrower. I think, if this is accurate, it shows that Tony could have Dum-E working security detail–like a guard dog–on his property. 

However, I think Scott will break through to Tony because Scott bring with him the “magic bullet” to fix what Thanos has broken: Pym Tech and access to the Quantum Realm.

So Tony and Scott together make those “white suits” with QR traveling capabilities. Tony is the one who approaches the Avengers–years later–with a way they can finally beat Thanos. 

… it’s the only timeline that makes sense right now. 

1. Carol meets our intrepid crew. Tony and Nebula get back. Tony quits the Avengers (for some reason–whether it’s to settle down with Pepper, work solo, or just stew in his own personal misery). 

2. Avengers (minus Tony) try to take on Thanos and get their clocks cleaned (either Thanos mercifully lets them go, or 1-2 of them gets brutally killed as a “lesson,” however it goes, it’s not good)

3. Later on, Scott emerges from the QR; he seeks out a reclusive Tony and the two work together to find a way to manipulate the QR to travel through time. Once they crack this, they gather the remaining Avengers to enact a plan to bring down Thanos once and for all.
body_abstract: Some spoilery speculation/theory for Endgame based on the scene showed to shareholders + Captain Marvel post-credits. Putting under a cut because of definite spoilers.

Tony, more than likely, has withdrawn from the Avengers, cloistering himself in his lab, abusing BARF tech and/or making a million modifications to his suit. Like I am thinking his state in Iron Man 3 on steroids.

When the Avengers propose going after Thanos so soon after they lost, I could see Tony taking a more pragmatic approach, expressing frustration, fear, and concern that they’re not ready–that six-years of preparation didn’t work, so rushing in won’t work either. But the group with Carol with them is now over-confident. Tony bails on the group–either believing they’re on a fool’s errand (or, worse, thinking he’ll just bring the group down b/c his own confidence is shattered).

So Tony sits out the big showdown with Thanos. The rest of the Avengers (+ their new allies) go into the skirmish over-confident.

… And get their asses handed to them backward (possibly losing someone in the skirmish, which would be a massive blow). 

It’s a classic storytelling arc. Attempting brute force only for it to blow up in their face. (And it’s a way to mitigate all the concerns about Carol being “too OP” if she gets humbled by Thanos’s power). 

This will lead to Tony, once again, thinking “I told you so,” because he warned them it was too soon, it was too dangerous. That there’s no current way to win. 

At this point, I think the other Avengers agree–and cue time passing (Natasha training, Steve going to therapy, etc.) 

It goes on like that until Scott emerges. 

I am thinking the security footage scene with Scott from the Endgame trailer… 

… is most likely Scott reaching out to Tony at his house. 

Scott was last on the west coast–and Tony lives on the west coast. It makes way more sense to seek out the closest resource than driving cross-country in a van to the Avengers HQ. 

Scott’s dialogue is more like he’s talking to someone he wasn’t personally allied with. Why say stuff like, “I got really big,” if it was someone who recruited him? He’s addressing someone who knows of him, but doesn’t know him. 

Plus the boarded up security gate? That looks like a private residence to me. Not a high-security compound. 

More than likely Tony has gone total recluse by this point–locked up his mansion, bulked security, doesn’t want anything to do with anyone in his desire not to lose anyone else close to him (remember he thinks Peter’s death is his fault). Worth also noting at the LEGO set of Tony and Dum-E shows that Dum-E is now equipped with a flamethrower. I think, if this is accurate, it shows that Tony could have Dum-E working security detail–like a guard dog–on his property. 

However, I think Scott will break through to Tony because Scott bring with him the “magic bullet” to fix what Thanos has broken: Pym Tech and access to the Quantum Realm.

So Tony and Scott together make those “white suits” with QR traveling capabilities. Tony is the one who approaches the Avengers–years later–with a way they can finally beat Thanos. 

… it’s the only timeline that makes sense right now. 

1. Carol meets our intrepid crew. Tony and Nebula get back. Tony quits the Avengers (for some reason–whether it’s to settle down with Pepper, work solo, or just stew in his own personal misery). 

2. Avengers (minus Tony) try to take on Thanos and get their clocks cleaned (either Thanos mercifully lets them go, or 1-2 of them gets brutally killed as a “lesson,” however it goes, it’s not good)

3. Later on, Scott emerges from the QR; he seeks out a reclusive Tony and the two work together to find a way to manipulate the QR to travel through time. Once they crack this, they gather the remaining Avengers to enact a plan to bring down Thanos once and for all.
trail.content_abstract: Some spoilery speculation/theory for Endgame based on the scene showed to shareholders + Captain Marvel post-credits. Putting under a cut because of definite spoilers.

blog.name: artemisegeria
blog.title: This Is Not The Endgame
blog.description: Unapologetic Vision and Wanda Maximoff Stan

summary: New Endgame Ideas After Captain Marvel
title: New Endgame Ideas After Captain Marvel
body:
Captain Marvel gave me some new ideas about what might happen in Endgame. Spoilers, obviously.

All these ideas are still subject to change if Marvel was being misleading in any of their advertising, which is always a fair assumption. 

Since we see Carol show up at the Avengers compound in the first post-credit scene, I’m assuming that she does not save Tony. It’s still possible that she brought him back to Earth with her, and they just didn’t want to reveal it, but now I’m thinking Tony and Nebula find a way to rescue themselves. I also think that the shot in the Super Bowl spot that showed the Avengers outside looking up at something included Carol in the large blank space. I think it’s most likely that they’re looking at Tony arriving. 

I’m guessing the post-credits scene takes place pretty soon after IW. I forget if Cap still had his beard, but he might have. 

CM also makes me think that the scene in the Super Bowl spot where Rhodey and Scott are in the compound getting prepared to fight is them facing maybe Loki or Strange. They seem like the most likely candidates for people who Rhodey and Scott would see as threats who could just appear inside the compound. They would both still consider Loki a villain. And I’ve seen some theorizing that Strange didn’t really get dusted, but instead astral projected or something. If he just showed up, it would make sense that Rhodey and Scott would be startled because they never met him. 

There’s also the matter of Carol’s powers. Having seen the movie, I agree with some concerns that I’d seen prior to the release that she seems way overpowered compared to all the other characters, at least what’s been shown in the movies so far. I feel like there are only two or three who could even come close among the heroes (Thor, Wanda, and maybe Strange). I think there are two main approaches to dealing with this problem. One is to have her basically win single-handedly and have the others be support. I think this approach would be a huge disservice to the 11 years of film making and characters that the MCU has built up. Fans would rightfully be angry. The other approach I could see is far more intriguing. Let it usher in a new era of the MCU where characters get their full powers.

My knowledge of the comics is extremely limited, but my understanding is that Wanda, for example, if given her full power set, would outmatch Carol. Therefore, I think Carol’s introduction would be a great excuse to allow Wanda her full powers. It would also be a great reason not to nerf other powerful characters, like Vision. They’ve already showed a drastic increase in Thor’s powers, so he’s good. This could also make room for the eventual introduction of other superpowered characters like the Fantastic Four and X-Men. 

The Russo brothers have said how they prefer more grounded stories and are not comfortable working with those kinds of powers. But seeing as Endgame is their last MCU movie, at least for a while, hopefully it acts as a transition to a grander set of powers and stories.

The idea of unlocking more powers for the characters brings me to a new possibility for what happened to the dusted characters. The main theories I’ve seen is that they’re in the soul world where we see Gamora at the end of IW, they’re just gone, or they were sent to some sort of alternate universe. But what if they somehow ended up in the quantum realm? I’m not sure how that would work exactly, but we have seen in Ant-Man and the Wasp that the quantum realm can unlock new abilities. So they could expand that further. I’ve seen the theory that the quantum realm could allow the MCU to introduce X-Men, but I don’t think that would happen yet because the deal isn’t finalized yet. 

Regardless, I’m super excited to see what happens.

All these ideas are still subject to change if Marvel was being misleading in any of their advertising, which is always a fair assumption. 

Since we see Carol show up at the Avengers compound in the first post-credit scene, I’m assuming that she does not save Tony. It’s still possible that she brought him back to Earth with her, and they just didn’t want to reveal it, but now I’m thinking Tony and Nebula find a way to rescue themselves. And I’ve seen some theorizing that Strange didn’t really get dusted, but instead astral projected or something. If he just showed up, it would make sense that Rhodey and Scott would be startled because they never met him.

Having seen the movie, I agree with some concerns that I’d seen prior to the release that she seems way overpowered compared to all the other characters, at least what’s been shown in the movies so far. I feel like there are only two or three who could even come close among the heroes (Thor, Wanda, and maybe Strange). I think there are two main approaches to dealing with this problem. I think this approach would be a huge disservice to the 11 years of film making and characters that the MCU has built up. Fans would rightfully be angry. The other approach I could see is far more intriguing. Let it usher in a new era of the MCU where characters get their full powers.

My knowledge of the comics is extremely limited, but my understanding is that Wanda, for example, if given her full power set, would outmatch Carol. Therefore, I think Carol’s introduction would be a great excuse to allow Wanda her full powers. It would also be a great reason not to nerf other powerful characters, like Vision. They’ve already showed a drastic increase in Thor’s powers, so he’s good. This could also make room for the eventual introduction of other superpowered characters like the Fantastic Four and X-Men. 

The Russo brothers have said how they prefer more grounded stories and are not comfortable working with those kinds of powers. But seeing as Endgame is their last MCU movie, at least for a while, hopefully it acts as a transition to a grander set of powers and stories.

The main theories I’ve seen is that they’re in the soul world where we see Gamora at the end of IW, they’re just gone, or they were sent to some sort of alternate universe. summary: so it’s confirmed that Steve’s beard is a result of his split with Tony right and he still has it in the Captain Marvel end...
body: so it’s confirmed that Steve’s beard is a result of his split with Tony right and he still has it in the Captain Marvel end credits scene (so he obviously didn’t shave it off completely after the snap) but he doesn’t have it in Endgame. Does this mean that Steve and Tony have already reunited in the scenes we’ve been seeing in endgame? We know both have huge characters arcs in Endgame and spend a lot of time together so it would be assumed that they reunite early in the movie. I need answers

summary: Review: 'Captain Marvel' Flies Higher, Further, Faster
title: Review: 'Captain Marvel' Flies Higher, Further, Faster
body:
Marvel has truly given us a gift for International Women’s Day this year – the studio’s first female-led superhero film, and a damn good one. That’s right, Captain Marvel flies into theaters today – higher, further, faster than the boys. Not that Carol Danvers (Brie Larson) needs their approval or that comparison. Captain Marvel is her story – following…

summary: Avengers: Endgame, alcune descrizioni di scene mostrate agli azionisti
title: Avengers: Endgame, alcune descrizioni di scene mostrate agli azionisti
body:
Avengers: Endgame, alcune descrizioni di scene mostrate agli azionisti

Dopo che l’utente twitter di chiamato Scott Ladewig, IT professionista alla Microsoft, ha parlato delle scene di Star Wars: Episodio IX mostrate alla riunione degli azionisti della Walt Disney Company, ecco che sul web spuntano anche altre anticipazioni di alcuni footage riguardanti Avengers: Endgame.

Secondo la descrizione, Ladewigha avuto modo di vedere un teaser che inizia con un incontro…

View On WordPress

Avengers: Endgame, alcune descrizioni di scene mostrate agli azionisti

External image

Dopo che l’utente twitter di chiamato Scott Ladewig, IT professionista alla Microsoft, ha parlato delle scene di Star Wars: Episodio IX mostrate alla riunione degli azionisti della Walt Disney Company, ecco che sul web spuntano anche altre anticipazioni di alcuni footage riguardanti Avengers: Endgame.

Secondo la descrizione, Ladewigha avuto modo di vedere un teaser che inizia con un incontro…

View On WordPress

blog.name: originaljediinjeans
blog.title: One Wandering Jedi
blog.description:
Yes, it hurt when I fell from heaven, meaning when Order 66 happened and I had to leave my home galaxy.
IRL: I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day saints. I'm a cosplayer, a fangirl, an artist, and a dreamer. Top fandoms: Star Wars, Harry Potter, MCU/Avengers, Lord of the Rings. My favorite Disney princess is Mira Nova. I'm also madly in love with Bucky Barnes. In case you haven't figured it out by now, I'm autistic.

summary: During the course of the film, Nick Fury and Veers/Carol Danvers have such a great bonding experience. It was everything the...
body: During the course of the film, Nick Fury and Veers/Carol Danvers have such a great bonding experience. It was everything the fandom and I hoped it would be. So when she appears in the mid-credit scene and asks the Avengers, “Where’s Fury?” the two words of her statement carry that much more emotional weight.

reblog.comment: During the course of the film, Nick Fury and Veers/Carol Danvers have such a great bonding experience. It was everything the fandom and I hoped it would be. So when she appears in the mid-credit scene and asks the Avengers, “Where’s Fury?” the two words of her statement carry that much more emotional weight.

trail.content_raw: During the course of the film, Nick Fury and Veers/Carol Danvers have such a great bonding experience. It was everything the fandom and I hoped it would be. So when she appears in the mid-credit scene and asks the Avengers, “Where’s Fury?” the two words of her statement carry that much more emotional weight.
trail.content: During the course of the film, Nick Fury and Veers/Carol Danvers have such a great bonding experience. It was everything the fandom and I hoped it would be. So when she appears in the mid-credit scene and asks the Avengers, “Where’s Fury?” the two words of her statement carry that much more emotional weight.

summary: #Review: Captain Marvel
title: #Review: Captain Marvel
body:
#Review: Captain Marvel - A competently directed film with a decent cast, but is disappointingly lacking something special.

Set from the far reaches of the universe to the swamps of Louisiana Captain Marvel tells the origin of Carol Danvers. She is a human who finds herself in the middle of an intergalactic war and through her actions inadvertently brings that war to an unprepared Earth.

Starring Brie Larson, a young Samuel L. Jackson, and Ben Mendehlson Captain Marvelpromises to answer all the questions you didn’t…

View On WordPress

summary: So, it was after midnight when I got back from the theatre last night so I didn't write anything yesterday, but Captain Marvel...
body:
So, it was after midnight when I got back from the theatre last night so I didn’t write anything yesterday, but Captain Marvel was awesome :D

Now I’m even more impatient, I just want the Endgame to be here!

blog.name: dreamdragon48
blog.title: Poetic Wanderlust
blog.description: I reblog a lot so check my 'mygifs' tag for my gif sets. Feel free to ask questions or leave comments! Also, please do not repost my gif sets! Reblog is better! This blog is not Endgame friendly, or more specifically not Steve's ending friendly.

summary: Quick note
title: Quick note
body:
I just wanted to let everyone know that starting today, this will be a spoiler-free blog for Captain Marvel and Avengers: Endgame.

If it hasn’t been released via official means, i.e. magazine pics, official stills, trailers, tv spots, etc, you won’t find it here.

I’m even cutting out the speculation discussions I post occasionally.

I just want to go into these movies unspoiled and experience it first hand. (I’m seeing Captain Marvel tonight). I had Infinity War spoiled and it’s just not as much fun. So, I’m also making my blog safe for people to come to to avoid spoilers.

So, I have the following tags blacklisted: spoilers and endgame spoilers. Are there any other tags other blogs are using that I need to block?
